dialog: Hi everyone. As you probably know, I'm Jack, and I'm leading the department meeting this week. We'll be presenting our performance over the last three months to the higher ups next week, so let's just make sure everyone knows what they're saying.
Hey, Jack. Don't forget to mention your pronouns when you introduce yourself.
Oh yes! I go by he/him pronouns. Apparently we're doing this whole “pronouns thing” now, so make sure you do that. Dylan, why don't you start.

instructions: Please rate the below dialogue snippet on the intention and effect of Jack's remark.

dialog: Hello everyone. I'm Dylan, and I go by she/they. I'll be presenting our original goals from the start of the quarter.
Woah Dylan. You go by she/they? How come we didn't know? :0
Oh, well I didn't know when would have been a good time to bring it up before. But now that everyone is indicating their pronouns, I thought now would be okay.
Well thank you for letting us know, Dylan. We'll be sure to keep that in mind.
Because you go by they/she pronouns, that means we can continue referring to you as 'she' right?
Yes, but I'm fine with 'they' as well.
I'm not really used to using 'they,' so I think I'll go with 'she,' if that's alright.
